# My Labor Arbitration Journey
After more than half a year, it has finally come to an end. Although the process was very tortuous, the final result was still satisfactory.
Here, I want to sincerely thank everyone on V2EX who has helped me.
I sincerely thank you all for your suggestions back then.
I also thank V2EX for providing this platform, which gives me the meaning to share.
The following is some of my journey, and I hope it can be helpful to everyone.
## July 28, 2024: Preparing for Labor Arbitration
After fruitless communication with the company, I prepared for labor arbitration.

At that time, as someone newly entering the workplace, I didn't quite understand what 'five social insurances and one housing fund' were, let alone labor arbitration. So I started seeking help from all sides.
Fortunately, with the help of V2EX users, I followed the advice and applied for a lawyer at the Legal Aid Center. Afterwards, I also followed the advice to supplement and collect evidence, etc.
### About applying for a lawyer:
Must have an agricultural household registration (æˆ·å£), and a certificate of agricultural household registration nature needs to be issued. The local town police station can issue this.
## August 1, 2024: Sign the agreement and submit the arbitration application
After signing the agreement and power of attorney with the Legal Aid Center, I started coordinating with the lawyer.
On August 3rd, I submitted the labor arbitration application to the arbitration committee.

I filed the lawsuit with the arbitration committee in the jurisdiction where I worked, and I could also file a lawsuit with the arbitration committee in the company's place of registration (this is where the subsequent troubles also lie).
A week later, I received a notice of hearing, tentatively scheduled for mid-August.
During this period, I discussed the details with the lawyer and prepared a defense statement.
### August 14: First Hearing
On the day of the hearing, none of the company's personnel attended, so I could only submit evidence unilaterally.
The judge asked me to provide proof of working in Xicheng. At that time, I only had DingTalk check-in records in the form of screenshots.
The judge didn't accept it and asked me to show the 'original carrier' of the evidence.
However, the company kicked me out of the DingTalk group chat three days after notifying me, so there was no company authentication on DingTalk, and the judge didn't accept the evidence.
**Recommendation**: Be sure to save relevant evidence in a timely manner. It is best to use video recording software with watermarks to save evidence in video format.
Later, I showed the judge the chat records of the WeChat work group, but WeChat also had no company authentication and could not prove the employment relationship between me and the company.
Therefore, the judge suggested that we file a lawsuit with the arbitration committee in the company's place of registration regarding the issue of jurisdiction.
The lawyer was also a little confused, and brought me to find a lot of evidence, but the judge didn't accept it.
In the end, the judge gave us two options: submit a lawsuit to the company's place of registration or wait for the next hearing.
After communicating with the lawyer, I chose to wait for the next hearing, because if I resubmit the lawsuit, I would have to go to another district to reapply for a lawyer or go by myself.
### Complaint:
When filing the case, a photocopy of the screenshot can be used as proof of the work location. I don't know why it is not accepted during the hearing.
## September 3, 2024: Second Hearing
After half a month of waiting, the second hearing arrived.
During this period, the lawyer and I kept communicating about how to prove the work location, but coincidentally, the company sent someone over for the second time.
The judge asked him if he admitted that I worked in Xicheng, and he answered yes.
In this way, the evidence that had troubled me for half a month was passed over in one stroke.
The subsequent process proceeded normally, and both parties presented evidence.

The person sent by the company was my previous leader. I don't know if he thought the company would definitely win or what, but he recognized most of the evidence I presented, and he recognized my calculation method for compensation amount without even calculating it.

But later, when it came to his turn to present evidence, he was dumbfounded. I did not recognize most of the evidence he presented. On the key evidence, the 'Termination of Labor Contract Notice,' the company failed to provide strong evidence to prove my fault.

Instead, he presented evidence to the judge about me in some unimportant aspects, such as: not participating in company training, disobeying discipline, frequently asking for leave, etc. (Using DingTalk for live broadcast training during working hours, and using my own time off is also considered taking leave? Where does the saying of discipline come from in an employment relationship?).
The judge denied his evidence without even asking me if I admitted it.
Because the company did not attend the first hearing, it was not allowed to submit supplementary evidence again at the second hearing.
Later, the judge said even more devastatingly: If you really recognized this evidence, why didn't you write it into the termination notice at that time?
The following is still the normal process, and the judge persuaded and mediated from both sides.
Unexpectedly, the company chose not to mediate.
## October 14, 2024: The award came down
After a month and a half, the award finally came down.
When I got the award, I really felt like the hard days were over.
The final ruling was a final award, with compensation of 2n.
Since the amount was not large, the award was a final award. The company could no longer appeal, but could apply to the Intermediate People's Court to revoke the award.
I was also very happy and sent a pennant to the lawyer.
I thought I would get the money smoothly, but I didn't expect the company to delay it again and again...
## December 18, 2024: Application for Compulsory Execution
After a 45-day waiting period, the company did not apply to the Intermediate People's Court to revoke the award, nor did it compensate me.
So I prepared to apply for compulsory execution.
Fortunately, compulsory execution can be done online, without having to run around offline, which is relatively convenient.
The process of compulsory execution is like going through labor arbitration again, and you have to make various phone calls for consultation, submit materials, etc.
After several rejections, the online filing was successful on December 18, 2024.

I feel that this process is still relatively torturous, because even if you win the labor arbitration, it does not mean that you can really get the money. I don't know if the waiting process is meaningful.
During this period, my father called me. I didn't want to tell them at first, but paper can't contain fire after all.
My father is a farmer with relatively traditional ideas. He still lives in the era when officials are the sky (it seems there is nothing wrong with that even now).
He scolded me for not doing a good job and fighting lawsuits with others, fighting with the company. How can we possibly win against them?
Due to repeated waiting, I also began to wonder, can I really get the money, is this really right, is it meaningful?
## January 3, 2025: Successful Execution, Get Compensation
At that time, I had no idea of â€‹â€‹finding a job, and even had some resistance to work.
Later, when I communicated with many classmates, I found that they were also laid off. As fresh graduates, we were not doing well.

A classmate said that the country would solve the employment problem and would subsidize companies that recruit fresh graduates. The company would find ways to â€œremoveâ€ our status as fresh graduates.
In this way, with the idea of â€‹â€‹lying down at home rather than wasting energy outside, I returned home before the New Year.
After returning home, my mood brightened a lot, and good news followed.
After the enforcement judge communicated with me several times, he decided to conduct an on-site enforcement on January 3.

Fortunately, I provided the judge with several accurate phone numbers, and the execution process was very smooth (here I suggest that you keep the information of relevant personnel as soon as possible and make plans early).
I also got the money smoothly a few days ago.
The matter is also considered to be over.
Currently, I am learning and looking for a job, learning more technical stacks and enriching my skills. I hope to find a satisfactory job soon.
I also wish you all the best and have a good future!

So what is the use of this labor law?

It has become a clause to protect companies in disguise. Ordinary people know that they have to go through such a complicated process, which has dissuaded most people. The company is completely unscrupulous and directly asks you to go to arbitration. Even if it is ruled, they will not give it to you, and you have to go through compulsory execution. This process takes at least half a year and at most one and a half years.

I have personally seen some companies file a lawsuit against you with false evidence after the verdict, disgusting you again and wasting another half a year. However, even if the company loses in the end, there is no punishment, and the employee can only get the 2n they deserve, and the company has no loss at all.

Congratulations! I remember one time when I was taking a taxi with a colleague, the driver was chatting and talked about his own lawsuits. He said that he had fought many lawsuits and talked a little bit about them.
After getting out of the car, my colleague told me that he didn't like people who always sue.
But I want to say, you have to protect your own rights, and it's perfectly legitimate to sue.

Later, when I was renting a house, I searched for the problem of sub-letters. At that time, sub-letters in Beijing were particularly rampant. I even encountered the original tenant when I was looking at a house once, and secretly told me not to rent from this sub-letter.

But some people were cheated by sub-letters and sued to get their money back. Don't be afraid of trouble, don't be afraid of suing is bad, you have to sue when you should. This is to protect your rights for yourself, and it is also to reduce unhealthy trends for the whole society.
Even if the law is unreasonable, there is a possibility of amending the law if it is noisy.
If you accept everything, then you really have nothing.
@Jammmm Yes, I recommend various forms of evidence preservation, backup and storage, etc.

DingTalk, a software designed for enterprises, will not side with ordinary people like us. After being kicked out of DingTalk, all your check-in records, salary slips, chat records, company certifications, etc. will disappear.
So I suggest keeping evidence as soon as possible, keeping evidence in multiple forms, and using multiple devices to keep evidence.
@unco020511 The law stipulates that illegal dismissal is 2N, that is to say, the company should have paid 2N.

The original poster worked hard to fight the lawsuit, but the company did not give the money after the verdict. In the end, the original poster had to go through compulsory execution, and the company only paid the 2N stipulated by law in the end.

That's how it is in China. Labor contract disputes for wage arrears are not complicated. You don't even need a lawyer if you understand it yourself, but compulsory execution in the end is very difficult. In LZ's case, the judge helped with the on-site execution. In many cases, only the boss is put on the 'List of Dishonest Persons Subject to Enforcement,' restricting high spending, etc.

The environment is still too friendly to dishonest people, especially in China where various bank cards are subject to risk control and card locking at every turn. It is too difficult for ordinary people to provide evidence of how dishonest people transfer assets.
@Jasmine2016 If it's convenient, I suggest you keep them all, because it won't be very convenient to ask for them again after you leave.
I gave the judge the phone numbers of the chairman of the company and the leader of the branch.
Also, you can go to the National Enterprise Credit Information Disclosure System to check the shareholders of the company.
Through their names, see if you can find their phone numbers within the company.
In short, you should be able to get the company's boss's phone number.
